contentList.content: Actions are your primary resource in combat.
Bonus Actions are your secondary resource in combat.
Reactions are responses you can have to events which can trigger both during and outside of your turn.

While enabled, this character will not participate in combat encounters. All non-participants vanish at the beginning of combat, only reappearing once combat has ended.

Should all other party memberes flee combat, this character will have three turns to leave combat as well. After three turns, if they are still in combat, they will immediately die.

If all members of the party have either been defeated or are non-participants, the game will immediately end.

While enabled, this character will not initially participate in combat encounters. All non-participants vanish at the beginning of combat, only reappearing once combat has ended.

Once all allied active combatants have been killed, Downed, have fled combat, or are under the effects of Aether Suspension, this character will rejoin the combat encounter.
Affected creature will not participate in this combat encounter.

Affected creature will not participate in this combat encounter until all allied active combatants have been killed, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DOWNED">Downed</LSTag>, have fled combat, or are under the effects of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BANISHED">Aether Suspension</LSTag>.
Affected creature is the last line of defense! It's now or never!
Affected creature is unable to act, and will remain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DOWNED">Downed</LSTag> until the end of the current combat encounter.
Affected creature will die if combat has not ended when this condition expires.
Monk: Way of the Drunken Fist
Monk: Way of the Open Hand
Monk: Way of the Shadow Arts
Paladin: Oath of the Crowned Phoenix

Through magic, you convey your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Bard_Perform_Whistle">Performances</LSTag> without making a sound, halving their area of effect but allowing you to act freely. While performing, you may also toggle this on in order to end your Performance.

All conditions and debilitations which utilize <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> are considered to either be physical or mental. Applying a physical condition always utilizes the highest of either your Strength or Dexterity when calculating your <LSTag Tooltip="DifficultyClass">Difficulty Class</LSTag>. When applying a mental condition, this class utilizes this ability to calculate your Difficulty Class.
Knock someone <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="UNCONSCIOUS">Unconscious</LSTag> instead of killing them. No effect on Undead or Constructs. This can be toggled at any time.

With nothing equipped in your
off-hand equipment slots, gain an additional Action once every three turns. In addition, you gain a +2
bonus to Attack Rolls and your Initiative, as well as the ability to make an Unarmed Strike using your Bonus Action.

Affected creature will gain an additional <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">Action</LSTag> upon reaching three stacks of this condition. This condition is immediately removed if in a state in which Free Handling charges cannot be accrued.

Affected creature has gained an additional <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">Action</LSTag> this turn. This condition is immediately removed if in a state in which Free Handling charges cannot be accrued.

Once per turn, upon expending an Action, you will generate one stack of Free Handling: Action. This can be toggled at any time.

Upon generating three stacks, you will immediately receive an additional Action until the end of your turn.

In addition, you gain a +2 bonus to Attack Rolls and your Initiative. This can be toggled at any time.

Affected creature will gain an additional <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag> upon reaching three stacks of this condition. This condition is immediately removed if in a state in which Free Handling charges cannot be accrued.

Affected creature has gained an additional <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag> this turn. This condition is immediately removed if in a state in which Free Handling charges cannot be accrued.

Once per turn, upon expending an Bonus Action, you will generate one stack of Free Handling: Bonus Action. This can be toggled at any time.

Upon generating three stacks, you will immediately receive an additional Bonus Action until the end of your turn.

In addition, you gain a +2 bonus to Attack Rolls and your Initiative. This can be toggled at any time.

While <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="INVISIBLE">Invisible</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SNEAKING">Sneaking</LSTag> and wielding a Hand Crossbow, you may make basic <LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">Ranged Weapon Attacks</LSTag> as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag>. This can be toggled at any time.

You add your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> with all weapons.

Landing a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> or killing blow will restore one Duellist Charge.
Make a melee attack with your main-hand weapon.

Make a ranged attack with both of your ranged weapons.

Choose additional spells from the list below. Spells within this list change depending on your choice of subclass. Spells require <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slots</LSTag> to cast, unless a feature states otherwise.

Muscles and physical power. Improves your accuracy and damage with <LSTag Tooltip="MeleeWeaponAttack">Melee</LSTag> weapons. Also applies an additional global bonus to all physical Melee damage dealt when you have no weapon in your off-hand, along with improving how far you can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_Jump">Jump</LSTag> and how much you can <LSTag Tooltip="CarryWeight">Carry</LSTag>.

Agility and balance. Improves your accuracy and damage with <LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">Ranged</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Finesse">Finesse</LSTag> weapons. Also improves your Initiative, and <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> when wearing Clothing, Light Armour, or Medium Armour.
Stamina and physical endurance. Increases the amount of <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag> you gain per level and reduces physical damage taken when wearing Medium or Heavy Armour.
Astuteness and memory. Improves <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">Spellcasting</LSTag> for Rogues and Wizards, as well as their ability to apply Conditions.
Sense and intuition. Improves <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">Spellcasting</LSTag> for Clerics, Druids, Monks, and Rangers, as well as their ability to apply Conditions.

Fortitude and resilience. Improves <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">Spellcasting</LSTag> for Barbarians, Bards, Fighters, Paladins, Sorcerers, and Warlocks, as well as their ability to apply Conditions.

While wearing Medium or Heavy Armour, physical damage suffered due to a Melee or Ranged <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, or due to a Spell, is reduced by an amount equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Constitution Modifier</LSTag>.

Armour Class bonus from Dexterity limited to +2.
Damage Reduction from Constitution limited to -2.

Armour Class is unaffected by your Dexterity.
Damage Reduction from Constitution has no limit.

When you are about to receive physical damage due to a Melee or Ranged <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, or due to a Spell, you utilize your armour to lessen the blow and reduce the damage. Damage is reduced by a value equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Constitution Modifier</LSTag>.
Once per turn, after having made an unarmed or weapon based <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, you may make an additional attack for free.

Gain an additional Action at all times.

This passive acts as a replacement of Extra Attack.

Once per turn, after having made an unarmed or weapon based Attack Roll, or after having cast a Spell, you may make an additional attack for free.

This passive acts as a replacement of Extra Attack.
While assuming the form of a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape">Wild Shape</LSTag>, you gain an additional <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">Action</LSTag>.

Ends the day and restores all <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag> and resources.
To take a Long Rest, go to camp and use <LSTag Tooltip="CampSupplies">Camp Supplies</LSTag>. If you don't have enough Camp Supplies, you will not regain any resources.

Use the campfire button to go to camp, restoring <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slots</LSTag>.
Fully resting requires <LSTag Tooltip="CampSupplies">Camp Supplies</LSTag>. If you don't have enough supplies, you will not regain any resources.
